Troop is paying the payment processing fee and we're contributing the large plastic storage container for everything to go into.";;;;;;;;;;;;;;;;;;;;;"Some need a hand more than others when it comes to moving house
column5: especially if home has been a local shelter and personal posessions are minimal.   This can be the case for our neighbours experiencing homelessness who are taking their first step into permanent housing.

column1: The Breaking Barriers support team at the Christie Ossington Neighbourhood Centre (CONC) know all about the struggles our homeless neightbours experience.  As specialized program supervisors
column2: they assist program participants and shelter residents to take steps towards better health

column1: Through individualized housing plans that respect clients' personal needs and autonomy
column2: they strive to build a community where all individuals have a space to call home.

column1: So how can we help them do this amazing work?  They need housing starter kits.  These kits make the moving day
column2: and every day thereafter a lot easier for participants taking the step towards first-time housing.

column1: This week
column2: we ask Troop members to help us complete the list for one Breaking Barriers Housing Starter Kit:

column6: Mella Brown
column8: instructor at George Brown College’s AWCCA program
column9: and big-time dog lover; and
column11: a counsellor with 10 years of experience in the social justice field.

column1: As community workers in Toronto for over 25 years
column2: they know there is a need for a service that will look after pets while their owner attends short and/or long term support services.

column1: Through Ruff Times offers pet care options so that people do not need to make a choice between accessing supports or losing their animal companions.
This is needed because:
i) A person may stay in a violent situation because they do not want to leave their beloved pet with the abuser.
ii) People opt out of going to hospitals or treatment centres because there is no one in their life who can care for their pet and there are no affordable or free boarding options.
iii) The grief of losing one's pet is devastating for both human and animal. This is a traumatic event that can hinder one's emotional
column2: mental and physical well-being and remain a constant source of pain throughout their life.";"Pet Intake Program";;;;;;;;;"Yes";;;;;;;;;;;;;;;;;;"No";;;;;;;;;;"Through Ruff Times works to reduce barriers for people who experience poverty

column9: ON M6N 4Y2";"Cancer was the impetus for Cid’s journey into the art world.  Initially
column10: painting was her means of escaping the cruel reality that a loved one had been diagnosed with terminal cancer. It soon became a passion and then an obsession.

column1: Cid’s mother lost her battle with cancer on June 13
column2: 2009. Her father succumbed to cancer on September 18
column3: 2010. Cid lived through the painful journey
column4: and also experienced first hand the emotional healing power of creative expression. The ART for Cancer Foundation
column6: represents the next step in her personal journey

column1: Research suggests that participation in creative experiences like painting can reduce anxiety
column2: promote relaxation and improve the overall quality of life of people living with cancer. This includes patients

column1: It is Cid’s hope that when cancer patients or their loved ones participate in one of the workshops
column2: they will find their inner voice and escape to their special sanctuary.";;;"ART For Cancer Foundation";;;;;;;;;"185";"8";;"a:5:{i:0;s:5:""82303"";i:1;s:5:""82304"";i:2;s:5:""82305"";i:3;s:5:""82306"";i:4;s:5:""82307"";}";;;;;;;;;;;;;;;;"ART For Cancer Foundation";;;"a:3:{s:5:""title"";s:0:"""";s:3:""url"";s:0:"""";s:6:""target"";s:0:"""";}";;"Charity";;;;;;;;;;;;;;;;;;;;;;;;;;;"2019-07-10 23:00:00";"Closed";"200";;;;;;;;;;;;;;;;;;;;;;;;;;"We met Cid Palacio a few months ago.  Her story and the impact she has on our community is just the type of thing Troop is all about sharing.

column1: It was 2011 when Cid realized that creative expression through painting was what held her together after losing both parents to cancer within 15 months of each other.  She started the ART For Cancer Foundation as a way to help those living with cancer to heal and has been offering FREE workshops and courses to cancer patients and their families ever since.
“Art is a creative outlet for the emotions experienced when cancer strikes”
column2: says Cid.  “Research has shown that any focus on creativity will help you cope or heal during a difficult situation”.  One workshop participant put it well
column3: “Art got me through.  It provided the means to express what there were no words for”.

column1: ART For Cancer Foundation offers a range of programs from beginner workshops to more in-depth multi-week programs that end with an art exhibition.";"Healing Happens When One Creates Something";;;;;;;;;"Yes";;;;;;;;;;;;;;;;;;"Yes";;;;;;;;;;"ART For Cancer Foundation offers a range of programs from beginner workshops to more in-depth multi-week programs that ends with an art exhibition.";;;;;;;;;;;;;;;;;;;;"closed

column5: we're pooling funds to purchase Tara two tickets to the production of Come From Away playing at The Prince of Wales Theatre.  This acclaimed musical production shows the capacity for human kindness in even the darkest of times.  Appropriate?  We think so!  Any extra money raised will go towards TTC vouchers.";;;;;;;;;;;;;;;;;;;;;"We think you would want to throw the most epic 18th birthday party ever! And that's just what we're planning to do for Tara.

column1: We met Tara through Arrabon House
column2: a registered charity in Toronto helping women aged 13-24 who are survivors of abuse
column3: trauma and mental health issues.   Tara (and that's not her real name
column4: for obvious reasons) joined the Arrabon group home last October when she made the difficult decision to escape the cult environment she grew up in and leave her family.  This was a hard decision
column5: but Tara was determined to get out.  The process of leaving wasn't easy with heavy shaming and guilt-tripping
column6: at times it felt near impossible.

column1: Her former life was riddled with strict rules including no relationships with outside people
column2: no birthday celebrations
column4: no celebrations at all.  So as Tara's birthday approaches at the beginning of August
column5: she tells us: ""Since I have never celebrated (a birthday)
column6: I'm looking forward to experiencing one.  It's funny that I didn't get one as a child
column7: but I think now is a good time to start.""

column1: Well
column2: so do we!  As Tara starts her new life with the support of Arrabon House
column3: we ask Troop members to help us celebrate her courage and fulfill her birthday wishes.";"If your 18th birthday was the first birthday you ever celebrated
column4: what would you do?";;;;;;;;;"Yes";;;;;;;;;;;;;;;;;;"No";;;;;;;;;;"Arrabon House empowers young women to grow to their full potential through supportive housing in Toronto.";;;;;;;;;;;;;;;;;;"Supportive housing to empower young women to grow to their full potential";;"closed

column13: they offer comprehensive and effective harm reduction services and a full range of addiction treatment services that are amenable to an individual’s needs and goals. Their services are offered through community-based facilities with a focus on street and community outreach.

column1: Harm reduction is at the core of their practice.  By incorporating a set of practical strategies that reduce the negative consequences of drug use
column2: they are able to support people who use drugs to live better
column3: according to their own definition of better
column4: while addressing the conditions of use

(There is no fee for this
column6: we cover the gas and the only charge for braving the Walmart line-up is an ounce of our sanity :))";;;;;;;;;;;;;;;;;;;;;"At a time when most twenty-somethings are trying to get a job and figure out how to make french toast
column7: Faith Wilson and Tim McConnell were working to fix a broken support system that lacked the services they so needed when they were growing up suffering from substance abuse.   As transgender youths
column8: they found themselves in a system grossly underserved by public health.

column1: This just didn't make sense to them given that LGBTQ individuals face increased health issues linked to societal stigma and discrimination.  Health issues like higher rates of psychiatric disorders
column2: substance abuse
column3: and suicide.  Instead of sitting back complaining about the problem
column4: they got to work trying to fix it.

column1: Enter the birth of Pieces to Pathways
column2: a peer-led program developed by Toronto's LGBTQ youth (aka Faith and Tim) for Toronto's LGBTQ youth.  Over the past three years
column3: they have worked tirelessly to bring the program to life and to secure the necessary funding to support the 150+ people they serve annually.  Three years ago their program was adopted by Breakaway Addiction Services
column4: a top addiction agency in Toronto with a 30-year track record of delivering addiction support services that change lives.

column1: Today
column2: Pieces to Pathways is Canada’s only substance use support program for LGBTTQQ2SIA youth ages 16-29.  They offer a drop-in program 3-days a week
column3: case management and group counselling. The drop-in sees 12-15 people each session and is an opportunity for LGBTTQQ2SIA youth to connect with others
column6: attend workshops

column1: So here's where the Troop need comes in... it is at the drop-in that Faith and Tim see the need for basic personal hygiene products.  Right now they ration any products they have when someone makes a request
column2: but it would be great to hand over a bottle of body wash or a toothbrush to someone who needs it.  That sounds like something our Troop members can help with.

column1: ;When they set their sights on fixing a problem
column2: and they do it.";;;;;;;;;"Yes";;;;;;;;;;;;;;;;;;"No";;;;;;;;;;"We're supporting those suffering with addiction issues through the Pieces to Pathways program offered by Breakaway Addiction Services.";;;;;;;;;;;;;;;;;;"Helping people with substance abuse issues";;"closed

Such a large scale item is difficult to find in the centre’s limited budget.";"2019-08-11 14:46:59";"dishwasher-drive";"kelvinhitroopcom2019";"publish";"https://hitroopcom.stage.site/wp-content/uploads/2019/08/brooke-lark-M4E7X3z80PQ-unsplash.jpg";;;;;;;;;;;;;;;;;;;;;"Please add any details you can about the need recipient (this will help create a personal connection between the need recipient and Troopers to increase chances of fulfillment

column7: ON M5T 1A8";"The Toronto Rape Crisis Centre/Multicultural Women Against Rape (TRCC/MWAR) provides peer support to survivors of sexual violence.  They work towards a violence-free world by providing anti-oppressive
column9: education and activism.  As an important pillar in the Toronto community since 1974
column10: their services have grown to include a 24hour crisis line
column12: court support and accompaniment
column13: advocacy
column17: and prison support.

column1: Through the creation of their longest-running support group
column2: the Latin American Women’s Program
column3: they offer these services in Spanish to all those people of Latin American origin who identify themselves as a survivor of gender
column5: including members of the LGBTQ community.

column1: The TRCC/MWAR has a core belief that survivors of sexual violence are experts in their own healing. Together they work toward creating a thriving community
column2: empowering survivors
column6: ages
column9: abilities and spiritualities.";;;"Toronto Rape Crisis Centre ";;;;;;;"Toronto";;"720";"26";;;;;;;;;;;;;;;;;;"This Is How Food Heals The Soul";;"https://hitroopcom.stage.site/blog/cleaning-dishes-has-never-been-so-amazing/";;;"Charity";;;;;;;;;;;;;;;;;;;;;;;;;;;"2019-08-21 00:00:00";"Closed";"500";"Parkdale";;;;"We're coming together to help the Toronto Rape Crisis Centre purchase a dishwasher so they can continue to feed and heal sexual assault survivors.  In order to meet Toronto Public Health guidelines
column10: they need to install a dishwasher.  Such a large scale item is difficult to find in the centre’s limited budget.  Now
column11: we're not talking about one of those expensive commercial machines - just a normal residential dishwasher will do the trick.  The machine they have their sights on is $499.  If we blow this up and surpass the target
column12: any additional money raised will go towards food vouchers from Freshco.  ";;;;;;;;;;;;;;;;;;;;;"In every society sharing food is an important building block in creating community.  Preparing a meal for someone is a simple way to show you care and it's one of the ways the Toronto Rape Crisis Centre builds a community of trust and support.

column1: Nourishing food is always available for the sexual assault survivors who walk through their doors.  Whether they come from the 24-hour crisis line which receives up to 45 calls a day
column2: or through one of many support groups
column4: or other programs serving up-to 50 different individuals each week
column5: they will find a safe table to heal their minds and bodies.

column1: Staff divide the responsibility of cooking the one main meal a day
column2: typically shared with 5-20 people.   The meals vary to meet the preferences of a diverse community built through services addressing some of our most marginalized survivors.  The Older Black Women’s Group and the Latin American Women’s Program are two such services which have been supporting sexual assault survivors within these communities for decades.   The more recent Trans and Non-Binary Program just adds to this diversity.

column1: So here's the kicker
column2: in order to meet the Toronto Public Health guidelines they must install a dishwasher because they feed the public from their centre.   Such a large scale item is difficult to find in the centre’s limited budget.  Now
column3: we're not talking about one of those expensive commercial machines - just a normal residential dishwasher will do the trick.

column1: This sounds like something that a group of caring residents can pitch in to help out with.  We call on Troop neighbours to help the Toronto Rape Crisis Centre continue their great work in nourishing the minds and bodies of sexual assault survivors. ";"The Toronto Rape Crisis Centre knows that food can help heal a soul just as much as it can nourish a body";"ON";;;;;;;;"Yes";;;;;;;;;;;;;;;;;;"No";;;;;;;;;;"Troop helps the Toronto Rape Crisis Centre fulfill the need of a dishwasher for the meals they serve sexual assult survivors.";;;;;;;;;;;;;;;;;;"Toronto Rape Crisis Centre";;"closed

column10: we cover the gas and brave the Walmart line-up.  ";;;;;;;;;;;;;;;;;;;;;"“I love helping kids that come from different countries and making them feel like I felt when I first came here.”

column1: That’s what Juanes said when we asked him why he was collecting backpacks for children new to Canada.  He remembers getting a backpack before starting at his new school three years ago after he arrived in Canada from Bogota
column2: Colombia.

column1: “My family and I were very happy and grateful
column2: and now I have the opportunity to give the kids at Romero House a backpack with school supplies”

column1: And he’s not doing it alone.  Dishaly was a resident at Romero House with Juanes when she arrived in Canada three years ago from Sir Lanka.  As a budding activist who has already been involved in a number of climate change actions by students here in Canada
column2: this backpack drive is yet another example of her ambition to defend human rights.

column1: Together
column2: Juanes and Dishaly have been running a summer kids club at the refugee centre
column3: so they have come to know and love the current kids of Romero House and want to make sure they have all they need to go back to school.

column1: Let’s give it up for these awesome kids and help them out with their back-to-school drive.  In pure Troop fashion
column2: getting involved with this need

column6: pick up and delivery.  We think it's fun.";;;;;;;;;;;;;;;;;;;;;"The Parkdale Community Food Bank (PCFB) has been providing nutritional support to those in our neighbourhood unable to meet their dietary needs.  They do it with dignity and respect for all who walk through their doors.  Oh
column7: and they do it out of the pure kindness of their hearts... because the Food Bank is predominantly run by volunteers.

column1: Back in 2007
column2: a bunch of caring neighbours stepped up when the 25-year-old Saint Phillip's Pantry was about to close
column3: threatening to leave the Parkdale community without a food bank.  Since then
column4: the team running PCFB has made it their mission to provide food to those in need

column1: They need over 50 committed volunteers to make the food bank work.  And with no direct funding from any level of government
column2: they rely on their partnership with The Daily Bread Food Bank and Second Harvest
column3: as well as support from the local neighbourhood to do their work.  Work that is so often the first step towards economic reintegration into the community for the people they serve.

column1: For the next week and a half (that's right
column2: this need will run a bit longer than the norm given the Labour Day weekend and the busy back-to-school week)
column3: we're helping PCFB by running a food drive.  You can pool funds with other neighbours and we'll do the shopping or
column4: clean out your pantry and put those non-perishable food items to use by registering for a FREE pickup.

column1: I Furiosi Baroque Ensemble;"83152";;;"2019-09-08 11:53:52";"i-furiosi-baroque-ensemble";"kelvinhitroopcom2019";"publish";;;"Between 1 October 2016 And 30 September 2017
column2: I Furiosi Baroque Ensemble Presented Five Concerts: ""Both Alike In Dignity"" (21 October 2016); ""Pants On Fire"" (7 January 2017); ""Ifork In The Road"" (21 April 2017); ""All About That Bass"" (2 June 2017); And ""Introduction To The Body"" (23 Sept. 2017).  The First Four Concerts Were Presented At Calvin Presbyterian Church
column6: M4V 1S5; The Fifth Concert Was Given At The Sackville
column7: New Brunswick Festival Of Early Music.  In 2016-2017 I Furiosi Explored Unusual Music And Themes Of The Baroque Period Using Authentic Technique.  World-Renowned Guest Performers Joined The Ensemble At All The Toront-Based Concerts.  More Contemporary Music Augmented The Themes And Revealed The Musical Origins Of Today'S Compositions.  The Audience Was Incorporated Into Interactive Theatrical Presentations Of The Pieces
column8: Augmented With Costuming In Order To Engage People More Fully.  Close To 1500 People Representing All Ages And Backgrounds Attended.  The Historically Accurate Concerts Included Comprehensive Programme Notes That Expounded On The Topics And Their Significance In The Baroque Period.  The Season Was Made Possible By The Volunteered Time Of Performing Artists

column1: Matthew House;"83357";;;"2019-09-08 11:55:11";"the-matthew-house";"kelvinhitroopcom2019";"publish";;;"Our Primary Goal Is To Restore Refugees‚Etm Dignity By Providing Shelter And Support In A Welcoming. Home-Like Setting. We Ensure That Their Indivudual Needs Are Met And Empower Refugees To Restart Their Lives In Canada. We Provide Emotional And Physical Support To Help Residents Heal From Their Journey And Establish New Lives In Canada. Our Services Are Offered In English & French As Well As Native Languages. We Offer And Orientation To Toronto With Things Like Opening A Bank Account And Enrolling In School. We Have One Reception House And Three Long-Term Transition Homes Where Additional Care And Support Are Provided. We Support And Mentor Youth Through Their Entire Settlement Journey And Set Them Up To Live Successfully On Their Own. We Encourage & Assist Other Groups To Establish Similar Homes For Refugees.";"Matthew House";;;"0";"-193221";"18766";;"0";"1401691";"0";;"1020125";"0";"23578";"0";"2270939";"891152944RR0001";;"Please add any details you can about the need recipient (this will help create a personal connection between the need recipient and Troopers to increase chances of fulfillment

A Refugee Mom Gets a Baby Shower;"83714";;"Imagine stepping off a plane in a foreign country with no family
column2: no friends and no possessions.  Now imagine you're 8 months pregnant.  That's the difficult situation Melat finds herself in after fleeing her home in Ethiopia.  She arrived on Canadian soil on August 28th and her baby is due to greet the world at the end of this month.  That's not much time to get settled and prepared for a newborn.  But heck
column3: Troop members don't shy away from pulling off a great Baby Shower in a matter of days - we got this!  ";"2019-09-15 11:06:20";"a-refugee-mom-gets-a-baby-shower";"kelvinhitroopcom2019";"publish";"https://hitroopcom.stage.site/wp-content/uploads/2019/09/baby-shower.jpg";;;;"https://www.amazon.ca/hz/wishlist/ls/15F9ID9F3T4HN?ref_=wl_share";;;;;;;;;;;;;;;;;"Please add any details you can about the need recipient (this will help create a personal connection between the need recipient and Troopers to increase chances of fulfillment
column6: hobbies
column7: etc).  You can use aliases for their real names to protect their privacy.";;;"Choose below";;;"Yes";"We pulled together an Amazon Wish List for the occasion.  All items will be shipped to Troop HQ so they can be packed up with everything else and delivered to Melat by the end of the week (so if you don't want to pay the rush delivery charge (hello
column9: consider pooling funds for the shopping trip instead... the options are endless!).";"Yes";"981 Dundas St W
column11: ON M6J 1W4";"Matthew House has been supporting refugees in downtown Toronto for over 20 years.  They offer shelter
column12: settlement support and newcomer programs to help make the best of what is often a difficult transition.  They aim to inspire hope
column13: restore dignity and empower independence for refugee claimants.

column1: They believe they can make a difference and they do.  Their work has inspired the opening of 10 additional refugee homes across Canada.  ";;;"Matthew House ";;;;;;;;;"405";"17";"100";;;;;;;;;;;;;;;;;"It's a Baby Shower";;"https://hitroopcom.stage.site/blog/the-world-is-good/";;;"Need";;;;;;;;;"Graco Stroller (we can all dream right!)";"https://hitroopcom.stage.site/wp-content/uploads/2019/09/stroller.jpg";"329.99";"Baby Swaddle Blankets";"https://hitroopcom.stage.site/wp-content/uploads/2019/09/swaddel-blankets.jpg";"24.99";"Flannel Receiving Blankets ";"https://hitroopcom.stage.site/wp-content/uploads/2019/09/receiving-blankets.jpg";"12.99";"Huggies Baby Wipes";"18.97";"https://hitroopcom.stage.site/wp-content/uploads/2019/09/Baby-wipes.jpg";"Hooded Towel Set ";"https://hitroopcom.stage.site/wp-content/uploads/2019/09/towels.jpg";"18.47";"Short Sleeve Bodysuit";"https://hitroopcom.stage.site/wp-content/uploads/2019/09/body-suit.jpg";"23.00";"2019-09-18 00:00:00";"Closed";"400";;;;;"Let's help Melat get ready to greet her baby the way any mom would want to.  We're pooling funds to get the baby basics - a stroller
column2: some blankets
column4: all that cuteness (100% of contributed funds will go towards the baby items Melat needs).  We'll hit up Walmart and Once Upon A Child in Etobicoke to spread the funds!

column1: ;;;;;;;;;;;;;;;;;;;;;Imagine stepping off a plane in a foreign country with no family
column2: no friends and no possessions.  Now imagine you're 8 months pregnant.  That's the difficult situation Melat finds herself in after fleeing her home in Ethiopia.  She arrived on Canadian soil on August 28th and her baby is due to greet the world at the end of this month.  That's not much time to get settled and prepared for a newborn.

column1: Thank goodness for Matthew House
column2: a registered charity supporting refugees in our neighbourhood.  They have the resources and experience to help Melat navigate the refugee claimant process and get the medical support she needs.

column1: And heck
column2: Troop members don't shy away from pulling off a great Baby Shower in a matter of days - we got this!

column1: Despite her complicated situation Melat is very happy she is safe in Canada and excited to meet the baby in her tummy.  She says
column2: ""Canada is so nice and so welcoming.  I have started sleeping again and breathing fresh air."" ";"Forget the Tim Hortons commercials! It's our turn to show a proper Canadian welcome.";;;;;;;;;"Yes";;;;;;;;;;;;;;;;;;"Yes";"Babies don't shy away from hand-me-downs and neither will Melat.  We're calling for the following slightly used items in good condition: stroller
column3: clothes and blankets.  The sex is unknown
column4: but whoever said a boy can't wear pink and girl blue?! This baby is coming in weeks folks!  (Update: we have the crib and a baby carrier!)";;;;;;;;;"Troop throws a baby shower for a soon-to-be mom who landed in Canada with no family
column5: no friends and no possessions and a baby due in weeks.";;;;;;;;;;;;;;;;;;"Troop helps a refugee mom";;"need";

column1: Bringing Comfort to Victims of Human Trafficking;"83835";;"It's a harsh reality that human trafficking exists in Toronto
column2: in our neighbourhood.  But it's a reality that can't be ignored
column3: particularly for the women struggling to escape that world.  From online chat rooms to female recruiters placed in schools
column4: the promise of fast cash for very little work can be far too enticing for vulnerable women. Traffickers prey on vulnerability
column5: and once the exploitation begins these women are trapped in a world that is hard to escape.";"2019-09-21 09:16:07";"bringing-comfort-to-victims-of-human-trafficking";"kelly";"publish";"https://hitroopcom.stage.site/wp-content/uploads/2019/09/annie-spratt-gq5PECP8pHE-unsplash.jpg";;;;"https://amzn.to/305UF1n";;;;;;;;;;;;;;;;;"Please add any details you can about the need recipient (this will help create a personal connection between the need recipient and Troopers to increase chances of fulfillment
column6: i.e. age
column9: etc).  You can use aliases for their real names to protect their privacy.";;;"Choose below";;;"Yes";"If you're not into the pooled funds idea
column11: we offer up lots of options to help out.  You can purchase items from the Amazon wish list which will be added to the comfort packs.  These items are a bit more expensive than the Walmart trip we have planned
column12: but heck
column13: if you're a Famazon (only a fan of Amazon... we totally made that word up) we got you covered.";"Yes";"245 Eglinton Avenue East
column16: ON M4P 3B7";"Boost believes that every child deserves to be safe.  They are dedicated to the prevention of child abuse and violence through education
column17: awareness and collaboration with various community partners.  Under one roof
column20: medical and mental health agencies to provide an individualized and child-friendly response for every child who has experienced abuse.

column1: Since 2015
column2: Boost has been supporting youth under the age of 18 years who have been trafficked or at high risk of being exploited.  All of the youth they support live within the GTA
column3: where the trafficking also occurred.  These youth are from a range of socioeconomic backgrounds
column4: from single-parent families to duel-parent families; from low-income households to high-income households; anyone is at risk of being trafficked.";;;"Boost Child & Youth Advocacy Centre ";;;;;;;;;"390";"15";"86";;;;;;;;;;;;;;;;;"We're Giving the Gift of Comfort";;"https://hitroopcom.stage.site/blog/yes-human-trafficking-is-a-thing-in-toronto/";;;"Need";;;;;;;;;"Winter Knit Wool Socks (5 Pairs)";"https://hitroopcom.stage.site/wp-content/uploads/2019/09/socks.jpg";;"Fruit of the Loom 6-Pack Underwear";"https://hitroopcom.stage.site/wp-content/uploads/2019/09/underwear.jpg";;"Fruit of the Loom Joggers ";"https://hitroopcom.stage.site/wp-content/uploads/2019/09/joggers.jpg";;"Hanes Full Zip Hoodie";;"https://hitroopcom.stage.site/wp-content/uploads/2019/09/sweater.jpg";"PUMA Evercat Cambridge Tote";"https://hitroopcom.stage.site/wp-content/uploads/2019/09/tote.jpg";;"Dove Body Wash 1L Size";"https://hitroopcom.stage.site/wp-content/uploads/2019/09/Dove-bodywash.jpg";;"2019-09-25 00:00:00";"Closed";"455";;;;;"We'd love to offer our comfort packs to all 30 trafficking victims currently supported by Boost
column5: but that might be a bit ambitious!  We're setting a target of 7 comfort packs ($65 per pack).  As usual
column6: 100% of your funds will go towards the need and provide a bit of comfort to a survivor of human trafficking.  ";;;;;;;;;;;;;;;;;;;;;"It's a harsh reality that human trafficking exists in Toronto
column7: in our neighbourhood.  But it's a reality that can't be ignored
column8: particularly for the women struggling to escape that world.

column1: From online chat rooms to female recruiters placed in schools
column2: the promise of fast cash for very little work can be far too enticing for vulnerable women. Traffickers prey on vulnerability
column3: and once the exploitation begins these women are trapped in a world that is hard to escape.  Whether they falsely believe they are in a legitimate relationship
column4: have a debt to pay off or they fear negative retaliation against their family and loved ones - getting out is a long and hard process.

column1: At Boost Child & Youth Advocacy Centre
column2: they support over 30 trafficking victims and their families at any one time.  Their needs range in terms of emotional and mental support
column3: but all find themselves in the challenging position of trying to start over.

column1: We call on Troop members this week to offer these women a little bit of comfort in an otherwise very uncomfortable world.  We've created comfort packs - a tote bag containing a pair of jogging pants
column2: a sweater
column6: and a $5 Tim Horton's gift card.  Each comfort pack costs $65 and we're aiming to deliver 7 packs to the women supported by Boost.  Can you help with this week's local need?";"The smallest gift of comfort can go a long way
column7: even when healing from the tragedy of human trafficking";;;;;;;;;"Yes";;;;;;;;;;;;;;;;;;"No";;;;;;;;;;"Troop members come together to offer a bit of comfort to the survivors of human trafficking. Our comfort kit is a small offering of healing.";;;;;;;;;;;;;;;;;;"Troop brings a bit of comfort to victims of human trafficking with Boost Child & Youth Advocacy Centre";;"need";

When she first hears about a family who might need her help through her network of teachers

Troop wants to help CDI take the costume price-tag-fear out of Halloween.  We're calling on Troop members to pull out those boxes of costumes years ago so kids-in-need can experience the joy of trick-or-treating
